title: 103_hr3519
content:
The "Yellowstone National Park 125th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act" authorizes the minting of coins to commemorate the 125th anniversary of Yellowstone National Park. The Secretary of the Treasury will oversee the minting and issuance of these coins according to specified specifications. The Secretary will mint and issue commemorative coins for the 125th anniversary of Yellowstone National Park. The coins include 5 dollar gold coins, 1 dollar silver coins, and \1/2\ dollar clad coins, each with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The coins minted under this Act for the 125th anniversary of Yellowstone National Park shall be legal tender. The Secretary will obtain gold for coins minted under the Act from existing law and silver from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Minerals Stock Piling Act. The design of the coins will be determined. SEC. 5. DESIGN OF COINS: The coins minted under this Act will reflect Yellowstone National Park with designated value, year, and inscriptions. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with the United States Commission of Fine Arts and reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Coin Advisory Committee. SEC. 6. ISSUANCE OF COINS: Coins minted in 1997 under this Act will be in uncirculated and proof qualities, struck at a designated Mint facility. 

SEC. 7. SALE OF COINS. The Secretary will sell coins minted under this Act at face value plus costs and a surcharge. Bulk sales will be at a discount, prepaid orders accepted with a discount, and surcharges of $35 for 5 dollar coins and $7 for 1 dollar coins will apply. Sales of coins minted under this Act will include a surcharge of $7 per coin for 1 dollar coins and $1 per coin for 1/2 dollar coins. Surcharges from coin sales under this Act will be distributed as follows: 25% to Yellowstone National Park, 25% to the National Park Service, and 50% to reduce the national debt. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES: The Secretary must ensure that minting coins under this Act will not cost the Federal Government. 

SEC. 10. GENERAL WAIVER OF PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS: Most procurement laws do not apply to goods or services related to the coins authorized by this Act, except for equal employment opportunity laws.

SEC. 11. NUMISMATIC PUBLIC ENTERPRISE FUND: Coins issued under this Act are subject to the Numismatic Public Enterprise Fund regulations.
